snippet: A wolf known as 832F to researchers was the alpha female of Yellowstone National Park’s highly visible Lamar Canyon pack, and some wildlife watchers referred to her as a “rock star.”
abstract: Yellowstone National Park's most famous wolf, alpha female known as 832F, is shot and killed outside the park's boundaries in state-sanctioned harvest; wolf, a tourist favorite, was valued by scientists who track wolves to study their habits and threats to their survival.
lead_paragraph: A wolf known as 832F to researchers was the alpha female of Yellowstone National Park’s highly visible Lamar Canyon pack, and some wildlife watchers referred to her as a “rock star.”
